<target_code>
Here is the code of deinit_data:
```c
static void
deinit_data (void)
{
  if (NULL != resp_single)
    MHD_destroy_response (resp_single);
  resp_single = NULL;
  if (NULL != resps)
  {
    unsigned int i;
    for (i = 0; i < num_resps; ++i)
      MHD_destroy_response (resps[i]);
    num_resps = 0;
    free (resps);
  }
  resps = NULL;
  if (NULL != body_dyn)
    free (body_dyn);
  body_dyn = NULL;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: MISRA C Rule 17.2 concerns functions calling themselves directly or indirectly. The only code locations that can introduce indirect recursion are places that call other functions which might call back into deinit_data. The remaining fragments in this function are simple pointer null-checks, assignments to NULL, the loop control and the num_resps = 0 assignment. Those do not perform function calls and therefore cannot by themselves create direct or indirect recursion, so they do not need further investigation for Rule 17.2.
